### Available skills
- skill-creator: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations. (file: C:/Users/krkna/.codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/SKILL.md)
- skill-installer: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos). (file: C:/Users/krkna/.codex/skills/.system/skill-installer/SKILL.md)
### How to use skills
- Discovery: The list above is the skills available in this session (name + description + file path). Skill bodies live on disk at the listed paths.
- Trigger rules: If the user names a skill (with `$SkillName` or plain text) OR the task clearly matches a skill's description shown above, you must use that skill for that turn. Multiple mentions mean use them all. Do not carry skills across turns unless re-mentioned.
- Missing/blocked: If a named skill isn't in the list or the path can't be read, say so briefly and continue with the best fallback.
- How to use a skill (progressive disclosure):
  1) After deciding to use a skill, open its `SKILL.md`. Read only enough to follow the workflow.
  2) If `SKILL.md` points to extra folders such as `references/`, load only the specific files needed for the request; don't bulk-load everything.
  3) If `scripts/` exist, prefer running or patching them instead of retyping large code blocks.
  4) If `assets/` or templates exist, reuse them instead of recreating from scratch.
- Coordination and sequencing:
  - If multiple skills apply, choose the minimal set that covers the request and state the order you'll use them.
  - Announce which skill(s) you're using and why (one short line). If you skip an obvious skill, say why.
- Context hygiene:
  - Keep context small: summarize long sections instead of pasting them; only load extra files when needed.
  - Avoid deep reference-chasing: prefer opening only files directly linked from `SKILL.md` unless you're blocked.
  - When variants exist (frameworks, providers, domains), pick only the relevant reference file(s) and note that choice.
- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.

- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.

**Analyzing failing UI tests and accessibility roles**

Iâ€™m unpacking why tests for the Gantt chart fail, likely due to no tasks causing missing SVG roles, which breaks role-based test expectations. Iâ€™m also comparing DOM attributes for Kanban keys and focus issues and planning to create a detailed ASCII report covering all failing tests, blockers, and suggested fixes with priority and complexity. This involves checking selectors, attributes, and current vs expected states for multiple components.

payload.arguments:
{"command":"@'
# REPORT: AGENT 1 (TEST_ANALYST)

Failure Analysis (line numbers refer to tests/e2e/accessibility-comprehensive.spec.ts)

Kanban Board (5)
- should allow keyboard navigation between Kanban columns: expect data-column truthy at line 189; selector expects activeElement.getAttribute('data-column') after ArrowRight. Current behavior likely keeps focus on board or no columns rendered.
- should navigate between cards with arrow keys: expect data-card-id truthy at line 210; selector expects activeElement.getAttribute('data-card-id') after ArrowDown. Current behavior likely focuses column first or cards not focusable.
- should support Enter to select/activate cards: expect modal visible at line 235; selector expects [role="dialog"] after Enter on card. Current behavior opens context menu only (no modal), so assertion not satisfied.
- should support Space to move cards between columns: expect initialColumn != finalColumn at line 273; selector expects activeElement.closest('[data-column]'). Current behavior uses Space to open menu, no keyboard move, so column does not change.
- should have ARIA live region for announcements: expect count > 0 at line 285; selector is [aria-live]. Current behavior likely not rendering live region when board not present (no columns) or it exists but board not mounted.

Risk Matrix (5)
- should have aria-label on Risk Matrix container: expect ariaLabel truthy and matches /risk/ at lines 328-329; selector is Selectors.riskMatrix ([data-testid="risk-matrix"]). Current behavior likely missing attrs if D3 draw not run or svg not initialized.
- should have aria-label on risk cells: expect ariaLabel truthy and matches /(impact|likelihood|risk)/i at lines 344-345; selector [data-testid^="risk-cell"] or .risk-cell. Current behavior likely no cells rendered when risks empty.
- should have role="grid" for matrix structure: expect role === 'grid' at line 355; selector is Selectors.riskMatrix. Current behavior likely missing role on svg if draw not run.
- should have aria-labelledby for axes labels: expect ariaLabelledBy truthy at line 366; selector [data-testid="impact-axis"], [data-testid="likelihood-axis"]. Current behavior likely no axes rendered when risks empty.
- should announce risk level changes: expect live region count > 0 at line 379; selector [aria-live]. Current behavior likely missing aria-live in RiskMatrix DOM or not mounted.

Gantt Chart (5)
- should have aria-label on Gantt Chart container: expect ariaLabel truthy and matches /(gantt|timeline|schedule)/i at lines 423-424; selector Selectors.ganttChart ([data-testid="gantt-chart"]). Current behavior may render wrapper without aria-label when chart view not mounted.
- should have aria-label on task bars: expect ariaLabel truthy at line 439; selector [data-testid^="gantt-task"] or .gantt-task. Current behavior likely no task bars when tasks empty.
- should have role="list" or role="grid" for timeline structure: expect role in ['list','grid','table'] at line 449; selector Selectors.ganttChart. Current behavior missing role on container (role is only on svg during render).
- should have aria-describedby for task details: expect ariaDescribedBy truthy at line 463; selector [data-testid^="gantt-task"]. Current behavior likely no describedby on task bars.
- should support keyboard navigation through tasks: expect focused element tag in ['BUTTON','DIV','A'] at line 478 after focus+Tab. Current behavior likely focuses SVG or body, not interactive task element.

General A11y (7)
- Icon Alternatives: should have aria-label on icon-only buttons: expect ariaLabel truthy at line 510; selector button:not(:has-text) or parent of button svg. Current behavior has icon-only buttons without aria-label/aria-labelledby.
- Form Accessibility: should show error messages with aria-describedby: expect role alert or aria-live polite at line 625; selector [role="alert"], [aria-live="polite"] after invalid submit. Current behavior likely uses error text without ARIA semantics.
- Color Contrast: should have defined background colors: expect validCount > 0 at line 709; selector main, section, article, div[class*="container"]. Current behavior likely transparent backgrounds only.
- Focus Management: should move focus to first error field on validation: expect focused tag INPUT/TEXTAREA/SELECT at line 828; selector document.activeElement after invalid submit. Current behavior likely leaves focus on submit button.
